column5: I live the dream... I work for my dad  That means: 1. I get to sleep in every morning 2. I get longer breaks and lunches 3. I get to leave early every day 4. I get paid lots of money 5. I don't have to do anything    If any of that was true, i'd be a happy man  I'm a Tool and Die Maker, CNC Programmer, Tooling Designer/Engineer ( basically, I can do anything  )  We make Stamping Dies for mainly the Automotive Industry  We also do Production Stamping  I work at V.I.P. Industries

I work in the printing industry.We print flyers and small news papers for all over canada and the u.s.If you get the t.s.c flyer thats us.If you need any printing done Richter web printing will "HOOK" you up.
Interesting video Goran.
I sell drugs for a living.....pharmacist

Paramedic for the last 16 years, still love going to work. 99% pure boredom 1% sheer terror. Hunting and fishing the rest of time , doing some guiding !! Full time father to my two little girls 100% sheer terror, there at that age !!
WSIB adjudicator 10 years now. Relocating to Sault Ste. Marie in June. Looking forward to all the fishing I'll be doing.
I do... well... this.....  lol....  it doesnt pay much... but the summers are fun!!
i develop software for a financial services company.. that said anyone hiring programmers?
i am a seasonal zamboni driver and full time slacker

I am one of the thousands of casuals that got laid off from Dofasco, I unloaded ships that came into Dofasco....so right now I just fish and look for a good paying job and thats part of the reason I am still looking...not many out there.  Hope Dofasco gets there butt in gear and figures out the ownership stuff so I can go back to work
application analyst for a mid sized software company
I manage a group of test technicians in the Environmental Test and Qualfication Lab at Honeywell Aerospace.  You know, rocket science and stuff.

Everyone from all walks of life.. fishing is the great equalizer.  I have been an automotive Mechanic/tech for the last 23 years. For the last 13 have owned operated my 3 bay shop along with my brother who looks after the toy department( Boats, motors, atv, skidoos etc.) on the other side of the building. We get along just fine and we have 14 employees and still growing. Would not want to be anywhere else.
amazing to see how much diversity there is on OFC, with only one certain interest in common . . .  Mike
As 2007 get closer I'll be taking up a new postion as Minister Of The Gospel. I dumped my 14 years working at a Grocery Store.   dsn
Work as an RN in ER
Same as Fishindevil but I`ve got 14 yrs service  Doug
Cool stuff... My dad has been working at Stelco for 32 or 33 years now... he works on the Z line.  cd.

I am a Technical Sales Rep.I sell supplies to printing companies for presses ,prepress departments.wideformat printing(digital)and Flexo. I was in the Printing trade for 13 years and I have been on the road for 7 years. The Company is called Ernest Green and Son ,it has been around since 1950. www.ernestgreen.com. company is across Canada.  Mike
Calibration (Metrology) & Environmental Engineer in the pharmaceutical industry for the last 28 years, same group as Novopharm is part of.

....Well that's intersting Corey, perhaps I know him since I've worked in the area for most of my 28 years. The mill I'm currently on (4 stand) rolls the steel for the Z line and I drive the crane that loads them up for the Z line.

What I do is obvious, given the format i guess.  What have I been doing the past 10 years is something else.  Playing in business, sums it up pretty good. I've done everything from small business management to calculating costs for multi-million dollar contracts in the processed ham industry.  What a ride, I tell ya....  But what I REALLY want to get back to is small business. By far, it's the most rewarding work someone could ask for. Sure, there's tons of stress at times, and some months you don't know how you're gunna pull through... but it all washes away when you have that one on one conversation over the counter with a customer, who you know will come back for that personal touch that big box stores can't deliver. By far, it was the best working experience of my life.  I miss that job.... but slowly working my way towards it again.  Perhaps when my wife gets done with college (nursing), opportunities will be achievable.

We import raw materials to make jewellery and sell to jewellery stores. so if anyone on the board wants to save around 50 % off store prices pm me. we don't sell to public but do sell to friends and relatives, so anyone on here is a friend of mine.  bb

I'm a HVAC/R mechanic by trade doing commercial and Industrial work for over 25 years. I'm currently managing a department of Technicians that service laboratory and scientific equipment and instruments.  My hobby job for the past 13 years is part-time teaching apprentices in night school.  Ahhh....looking forward to retirement!

Drove Tractor Trailer for 30 yrs... got hurt .. went back to school.. with all my experience... now I teach people how to drive Tractor Trailer properly I hope after they leave me???? also now Teach Fork Lift, Dangerous Goods, Load Securment, Hours of Service & Air Brakes Instructor.. talk about busy??? and then I Organize a Fishing Derby for Kids as well as help other to... and time for Fishing
Telephone banking support, soon to be broker - im mostly a fisherman though.

Im a graphic designer from Cambridge. work over at Pride Signs Inc. www.pridesigns.com we are the only ones doing the new Shoppers Drugmart turnover, So if you have seen a new shoppers drugmart somewhere, Pride Signs fabricated it and installed it  we also do, Canadian Tire, Home Depot, Zehrs, Sears, SportChek. so on and so on

well first off I have 3 jobs I run a building company called stone mill construction as well I am now the Canadian distributor for Legend bass boats out of the US and I have just made a deal for a new fishing show that will be called the  Anglers Garage.

Retired now due to disability, International Brotherhood of Teamster local driver and dockman for a little over 30 years, a couple of years driving as a UAW driver for a box company, a few years doing this and that in factories and other places. Formerly a part time bass angler, home handy man, LOL Mr fix-it, now Mr. Pay someone else to fix it!
Presently Manager of Communicbale Disease Control for the West Region of Toronto Public Health ... never a dull moment
funeral director

been in the concrete business for 4 1/2 years now and a finisher for 4 of those years. did 10 jobs this year on my own and have tons of people wanting me to do work so i think im gonna have my own business next year   i do stamped driveways, patios, basement floors, garages, foundations, etc.  hard work but it keeps me in shape
I am a Formsetter, I form and pour concrete footings and foundation walls for mostly residential and some commercial projects.

lic auto mechanic by trade currently service manager at an Active Green+Ross at least thats what i do for money. I am really only living with either a fishing pole in my hand or a snowmobile under my butt
Lic marine mechanic in summer. Lic finish carpenter in winter. Once was E.E.T. Radio telephone operator. Fisherman on sundays. CX

I run a residential heating and cooling company.  Work to 2 wonderful retired owners who are amazing employers.  Treat myself and family really well and who understand that there are just some days where it is more important to be on the water than in the office.  Wouldn't trade it for much right now, unless Whopper's job paid really well.
Voice and Data Networks Manager for Staples Canada  sooooooooooo looking forward to adding retired to that
I work at the Zoo, circumcising Elephants for a living. The pay isn't that great... but the tips are HUGE!
Glen. Thanks for making me laugh first thing in the morning.

I've been running a successful business for 17 years now providing mechanical design drafting services to local industry and I truly enjoy it.    The projects I work on always provide new challenges and no two jobs are the same.  I have also done lots of home renovation plans and new home plans (architectural drafting), but I can no longer do that as the Ontario Gov't. has come out with new Building Code regulations that prevent me from being able to do those drawings, even tho' I have approx. 35 yrs. drafting experience.    That is unless I want to spend 2K on Bull courses and then pay approx. 6K/yr for Bull insurance. Apparently the Gov't. does not feel I am qualified, yet a home owner with no experience in this field is allowed to provide their own drawings (doesn't this sound like typical government??)  . Fortunately, the bulk of my work comes from industry and not residential.

Dax, those buildings in your picture....I help Underwrite the Insurance required to build them.  Generally I help Underwrite highway projects/extensions, large scale building/condo projects, hospitals, etc.
Liar, your a coffee queen, now get to work and get me a coffee

I have owned and operated a painting contracting business since 1993 as well as a guiding business since 2000.  So when I'm not out fishing I'm painting.  I'm thinking of starting another small business of flipping houses in the winter, all I need is to find a financier. Anyone interested ? Then the painting business can be sold.
Assistant Loans Manager for GMAC.

For almost 3 years now, owning and running a hearing clinic in Markham that does hearing testing, hearing aids and devices, providing counseling and information for hearing related topics.  It's surprising how many younger people are still blasting away their ears now and find their hearing dammaged a little later in life.  All you in the construction biz or around loud machinery, please wear proper hearing protection!!

dba for a company in the trace detection business.  we build explosive and narcotic "sniffers" among other things.  if you've been through an intl airport or other high security area, you've propably been sniffed by our machines.
General manager of Fin-tech Tackle Co the home of Title SHot & NuckleBall jigs.  Visit us at Fin-tech Tackle  Happy to show you around.
Retired fireman from Toronto, and now spend most of my free time trying to teach Eddyk how to actually catch a fish
I design and build networks... Making sure the 1's and 0's get to the right place. Latest thing I have learned is that offshore banks have lots of cash and lots of nice things.  cd.

I'm a lion tamer............... Seriously, I'm a Financial Advisor (for the past 9 1/2 years) and Life Insurance Agent.  Hey Rich, I used to cut meat and did just about everything in a grocery store when I was in school many years ago.

I work for a local commercial heat-treater. I work in both aluminum and molten salt baths. We do agricultural and auto parts. We have done everything from buggy springs for the Mennonites to parts for aerospace like the Canada-arm on the space shuttle.
I am a retired supervisor of the water works for the City of Toronto after 30 years. In my spare time I try to teach Lew that you cant catch Pickeral on 12" lures.
Retired now, this was my job charging liquid iron.   Now, all I want to do is Fish. To busy fishing, to work Someone has to do it. "Spiel" works in the next building, when he's not fishing
Custodial,maintenence for the school baord,good job,great benifits,eyecare,dental,and great pension plan been there for over 17yrs

Multimedia technician at our local university, covering everything from delivering equipment to classrooms, doing equipment maintenance, video conferencing, reserving videos from other ontario universities, installations of data projectors, screens, wiring, videoconferencing equipment, ordering new equipment for installations, scheduling equipment usage for classes and meetings, training profs and admins in usage of equipment, etc. etc. etc. kind of a jack of all trades sometimes. Sounds a bit wierd, but I get to meet new students, older students, professionals, industry professionals, politicians, and some famous people also(recently Gwynn Dyer, whom I have met before, and I think he remembered me, lol), I just do everything possible in my job to make the students experience in university a good experience, from the technology standpoint at least.
Have spent 39 years in Stelco Machine Shop, been a overhead craneman, forklift driver and machine operator,love my job and I  work with a great crew of guys))))))))))))))))) Rick.

Howdy,  Been working as a Receiving Manager / Purchaser at a large resort on Lake Muskoka, close to Gravenhurst. I work here but could never afford to stay or golf here.  Looking at the lake right now and it appears that the damn thing will never freeze.  Oh well, COME ON BASS SEASON !!!  Happy New Year All,   Hookset.

I've been bashing tin since '77. Hey Wayne. I just noticed on our website that we build aircraft hangars. Give us a call if you need one.  Northwest Installations  I'll be working on this thing on Jan. 2.

I'm a realtor and a jack of all trades to the delight of my better half. (I park tools in my garage) It's her list that eats up much of my spare time. (when I could be fishing with my OFC brothers and sisters)

I've been working at our family owned and run small business (in Brantford) selling high performance parts for the last 21 years (since I was a pup). We're into North American V-8's etc., and not really into the import scene. Check us out at www.brantperformance.ca if you're interested in finding out more.

Well for close to sixteen yrs i ran my own hair and beauty salon over in Europe along with also bringing up four kiddy winkles.  I sold up & I moved back to canada six yrs ago as of next month. Opened up my own antique business for two yrs here in dover. I did not much care for working seven days a week 10 HRS A DAY as it was eating way to much into my fishing time, Especially now that all my kiddy winkles are grown. So i closed up and took on a job as a manager of a clothing store here in dover. & i can honeslty say i absolutley love it, The owner even offered me an all expences paid trip to bahli FOR ALLMOST THREE MONTHS and had i of excepted i would have been on my way there with her right now........ Still nice to be the boss SO TO SPEAK but even better that i get to scheduale my own hrs which gives me plenty of play time on or beside the water.

I now work for Technicolor Toronto in the commercial department.  If you've seen any ford, baileys, mazda, sick kids etc. etc. commercials on tv lately, you've seen my work!  Don't work to hard everybody!  cheers, UF
